title: Trump says Mexico will stop sending oil to Cuba
description: Mexico is the single-largest supplier of oil to Cuba, which regularly suffers from energy shortages and mass blackouts

title: India-U.S. trade deal LIVE: Trump cuts India tariffs, says Modi will stop buying Russian oil
description: Trump said he was cutting tariffs on Indian goods to 18%.

title: Drone attack targets strategic northeast Congo city, authorities say, blaming M23
description: The government of ⁠Tshopo province, where Kisangani is located, said in a statement on Sunday (February 1, 2026) that the drones attempted to strike Bangoka International Airport between ​early Saturday (January 31, 2026) and early Sunday (February 1, 2026) ⁠but were shot down before reaching their target

title: Union Ministers hail ‘historic’ India-U.S. trade deal; Congress says PM has ‘capitulated finally’
description: India and the U.S. agreed to a trade deal under which Washington will bring down the reciprocal tariff on Indian goods to 18% from the current 25%

title: Epstein case: Hillary and Bill Clinton to testify in House
description: Bill and Hillary Clinton will testify before the house oversight committee regarding Jeffrey Epstein, averting criminal contempt charges.  Attorneys confirmed their compliance, though final deposition dates are pending.  Chairman James Comer insists on sworn testimony, rejecting alternative proposals.  This development follows Republican efforts to compel their appearance, marking a significant congressional action.

title: Aamir quietly drops by Arijit’s Jiaganj home, brings frenzy to its sleepy bylanes
Justice Department says it's taken down Epstein-related files that may have had victims’ information
description: It blamed the release of sensitive information that drew an outcry from victims and their lawyers on mistakes that were “technical or human error”

title: U.S. top diplomat in Venezuela says discussed 'transition' with interim leader
description: Rodriguez made several key appointments to her presidential cabinet on Monday, including tapping former Foreign Minister Felix Plasencia to lead Venezuela’s diplomatic mission in the United States.

title: FC bats for discom privatisation, debt clean-up via SPVs
Trump administration to create strategic reserve for rare earth elements
description: The minerals kept in the reserve would help to shield the manufacturers of autos, electronics and other goods from any supply chain disruptions

title: Bank Holidays in February 2026: Banks to remain closed for 9 days across India — Full city-wise list
Sweets and arsenic: Behind the ‘horse medicine’ plot that left 3 dead in Madhya Pradesh
Another BITS Pilani Goa student found dead in hostel, panel indicates ‘suicide contagion’
Bihar outpaces India’s GDP growth: State economy hits record Rs 9.9 lakh crore as manufacturing surges
Benchmark 10-year bond yields rise on record borrowing plan
FIR against him and protests looming, ‘Mohammad Deepak’ is resolute: ‘Someone has to speak up’
Morning Digest: 18% U.S. tariff on ‘Made in India’ products, says PM Modi after phone call with Trump; bulk submission of voter name deletion requests sparks outrage in Gujarat, Rajasthan, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: Centre has taken note of water contamination incident in Indore, Minister informs Rajya Sabha
description: In a written reply to a question, Union Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Tokhan Sahu said that the area has old pipelines dating back to 1997, adding that “some of it is damaged, so the municipal administration identified the old stretches of pipeline and included them under AMRUT 2.0”

title: ‘Difficulty in marriages’ prompts UP village to get a new name — Harinagar
India’s rocky road to trade deal with US: The flip-flops, political pitfalls
Indian Railways to pay Rs 9 lakh after 2-hour train delay costs student a career year: A landmark UP consumer court order
India’s only motor vehicle free hill station under threat: Why the NGT says horses are now Matheran’s biggest polluter
18% U.S. tariff on ‘Made in India’ products, says PM Modi after phone call with President Trump
description: Agreed to a trade deal between the United States and India, says U.S. President Trump; India will ‘buy much more from the United States and potentially, Venezuela’, he adds

title: SpaceX merges with Musk’s AI firm xAI as he pushes plans for space-based AI
Ukrainian capital Kyiv under missile attack, officials say
description: Kyiv Mayor ‍Vitali Klitschko ordered emergency medical crews to affected parts ‍of the city

title: Communal flare-up in a Chhattisgarh village: 6 homes torched, cops injured during rescue operation
‘Don’t compromise children’s education’: HC directs UP govt to scrutinise assistant teachers’ appointments
Clintons agree to testify in House Epstein investigation ahead of contempt vote
description: The decision could head off a planned vote in the Republican-led House of Representatives to hold the two prominent Democrats in contempt, which could lead to criminal charges

title: ‘Would like infra projects to come up in all sectors, involve more private finance’: MoF Expenditure Secretary Vumlunmang Vualnam
Accused of body-shaming professor, Gujarat nursing student hangs himself
description: A first-year nursing student in Nadiad died by suicide, leaving a note denying allegations of body-shaming professors and claiming he was wrongly framed. His father alleges the college administration deliberately isolated and pressured his son, leading to his depression. College authorities deny wrongdoing, stating they intervened after complaints about the student's conduct.

title: India-US trade deal: D-Street gets Trump card, set for big gains
description: According to Siddhartha Sanyal, Chief Economist, Bandhan Bank, the news of reduction of US tariff on India is a major positive, especially soon after the trade deal with the EU. “The end of the stalemate and the direction of the development is more important in this case than the quantum of the change in tariff as it opens room for further positive developments in near future.”

title: From calling India ‘tariff king’ to 25% extra duty for Russian oil, Trump finally fixed the tariff at 18%, one of the lowest
Let judge who convicted J&K separatist decide sentence: NIA court
description: Judge Sharma recorded that he joined the NIA court after Nov 20, 2025, whereas Judge Singh had been hearing the case since 2024 and pronounced the guilty verdict on Jan 14. Sharma also noted he received the case file only after Jan 16, by which time final arguments had already been concluded before Judge Singh.

title: India-US trade deal: How Indian exports diversified in the face of US tariffs, which sectors struggled
Ram Rahim plea: HC resumes hearing in journo murder case
description: On Jan 17, 2019, a special CBI court in Panchkula had sentenced the Dera chief and three others to life imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 for the 2002 murder of Sirsa-based journalist Ram Chander Chhatrapati, editor of ‘Poora Sach’ newspaper. Counsel for Gurmeet Ram Rahim contended that he was not named in the first chargesheet filed by police in 2002 and that his name was included in it “by way of revenge”.

title: Donald Trump urges House to vote quickly to end partial government shutdown
Individual taxpayers biggest beneficiary of tax deductions claimed on political donations
No proof of Parth’s role, says Pune top cop on land deal
description: Asked about Parth, Pune commissioner of police (CP) Amitesh Kumar said on Monday: “Our investigation so far has not revealed any involvement.” Although Parth has not been named in the FIR, Digvijay Amarsinh Patil, another of Amadea’s partners, and arrested tehsildar Suryakant Yewale are mentioned. Tejwani and Patil were signatories to the deal last year.

title: Ban entry of non-Hindus at UP temples, says VHP
16th Finance panel: Exit clauses must for cash transfer schemes
‘Punitive demolitions’ continue in UP despite SC order: Allahabad High Court flags non-compliance
‘I run 5 km every day. Can I build a decent muscular body without going to the gym?’
Sagittarius Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: Your drive to earn more is high, and you won’t mind taking risks
Scorpio Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: Staying in touch, even briefly, helps the relationship grow
Aries Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: Quick, practical fixes come easily today, helping you settle hassles fast
Capricorn Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: Security matters more than grand gestures today
Gemini Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: Avoid running after extra money or forcing new deals, as it may only disappoint

Leo Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: Big investments need planning — avoid impulsive moves
Libra Horoscope Today, 03 February 2026: A productive day at work spills into your personal life
Expert Explains: What 2026 Delhi Declaration tells about India’s approach to the Middle East
Despite Cameron Green's 'chucking' gesture, Usman Khawaja defends Pakistan bowler - 'Stigma is real'
description: Usman Khawaja backed Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq after Cameron Green’s “chucking” gesture sparked debate. Khawaja urged restraint, saying Tariq was cleared twice and asked critics to “stop jumping to conclusions.” Tariq explained his action stems from a biological elbow issue and stressed he is not throwing. Tariq remains a key part of Pakistan’s T20 World Cup plans.

title: Fresh parole for Kerala double-murder convicts sparks row, Oppn stages walkout
description: The case involves the 2019 political killing of Youth Congress workers Kripesh and Sarath Lal in Periya, a village in Kasaragod district in northern Kerala. CPM workers were convicted and handed double life terms by a trial court. Tenth accused Ranjith T was granted 15-day parole Monday, barely two-and-a-half months after similar relief earlier.

title: 3,000 illegal birth & death certificates cancelled in Maharashtra
description: The district administration conducted a thorough investigation and found that there was no record of these names. The health department raised the issue with state govt and informed the state registrar. Following directives from the state registrar, the health department started cancelling the certificates. So far, close to 3,000 certificates have been cancelled. The entire process will be completed in a week’s time.

title: India–US trade deal announced | Uncertainty over for global capital, China+1 strategy back in game: CEA
NCP vs NCP(SP): Bhujbal, Mushrif deny merger talks were on
description: NCP MP and state president Sunil Tatkare asked on Monday, “We had taken a collective decision to join the BJP-led NDA and people of the state have stamped their approval of Ajit dada’s decision in the 2024 assembly elections. Those speaking of a merger should answer whether they are fine with it.”

title: Days after Ajit Pawar's death in plane crash, parliamentary panel flags aviation safety concerns
description: “Non-scheduled flights carry high-net-worth passengers with a fixed objective, an event, a meeting, a function. That creates immense pressure on pilots to land at the intended destination at all costs, even when diversion would be the safer option,” said Capt Manoj Hathi, former senior flight operations inspector at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA).

title: 'Border 2' collection: Sunny Deol starrer crashes on its second Monday
description: On its second Monday, 'Border 2' struggled to maintain momentum, raking in only Rs 5.75 crore. This follows a robust opening and a productive first week, yet the Sunny Deol and Varun Dhawan film has experienced a sharp drop in revenues. Portraying events from the 1971 India-Pakistan War, it has nonetheless garnered an impressive Rs 281 crore on home soil.

title: After West Bengal row, non-veg back on Vande train
Father of 3 kills daughter to meet 2-child Maha poll norm
US-Iran tensions: Iran ready for talks with US on nuclear deal, says foreign minister
How long you will live is mainly decided by your genes: Study
description: The findings are based on an analysis of more than a century of lifespan data from large Scandinavian twin cohorts in Denmark and Sweden. Researchers studied identical and non-identical twins raised together and apart, as well as siblings of US centenarians. Most participants were born between 1870 and 1935, a period marked by high mortality from infectious diseases and accidents.

title: Delhi Confidential: Constituency over Capital
Delhi Govt to SC: Apollo refusing to treat poor, auction recommended
Abhimanyu experiment: MP govt hosps to get Garbh Sanskar rooms to ‘educate mind of fetus’
description: These dedicated spaces are meant to guide expectant parents through prenatal care rooted in traditional Indian practices, from positive thinking and lifestyle discipline to diet and emotional well-being. The idea: shape the mind of the unborn. CM Mohan Yadav announced the initiative Sunday in Indore, placing it under the Ayushman Bharat scheme and linking it to the Union ministry of Ayush.

title: INS condemns J&K police’s oral summons to journalists
In push to form govt in Manipur, NDA MLAs to meet today
Ann Michael turns heads in bold Super Bowl workout look as Drake Maye preps
description: Ann Michael Maye kicked off Super Bowl 2026 week with a viral workout post as the Patriots prepare to face the Seahawks. From supporting Drake Maye at key playoff moments to launching her NBC Sports Boston show, Ann’s rise mirrors New England’s return to the sport’s biggest stage.

title: Taken note of Indore water contamination, 12,634 leakages repaired, minister tells Rajya Sabha
'Unlawful': Bangladesh HC questions BCB over female crickters' safety
description: The Bangladesh High Court questioned the BCB’s failure to ensure a safe, harassment-free environment for women cricketers. It asked why such inaction should not be declared “unlawful, without lawful authority, and against public interest.” The court ordered BCB to implement its anti-sexual harassment policy and submit a report, following a writ over delayed action on harassment allegations.

title: UPA era marked by policy paralysis, scams, middlemen: Sonowal targets Congress
Madhya Pradesh cough syrup deaths: Four-year-old dies months after being in coma in AIIMS Nagpur
description: Betul Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr. Manoj Hurmade confirmed the child’s death and said the post-mortem examination was conducted in Nagpur, and the body was handed over to the family

title: Javed Ali Khan: ‘Need to revive National Integration Council to keep social fabric intact’
Opposition, Govt face off in Rajya Sabha over communal rift, SIR
Artificial limbs on table, Sadanandan Master targets CPM in RS over 1994 attack
At 90, Dalai Lama gets Grammy for audiobook ‘Meditations’
description: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA), which is headquartered at McLeod Ganj in Dharamshala, said the award is a profound honour for Tibetan society. Although the Grammy spread cheer in this hill town, celebrations are on hold as the Dalai Lama is in Karnataka. American singer-songwriter Rufus Wainwright received the award on his behalf.

title: NASA hit by fuel leak during practice countdown of moon rocket
description: The launch team began loading the 98-meter rocket with super-cold hydrogen and oxygen at Kennedy Space Centre; more than 2.6 million litres had to flow into the tanks and remain on board for several hours, mimicking the final stages of an actual countdown; a couple hours into the daylong operation, excessive hydrogen was detected near the bottom of the rocket

title: For caste census, mere self-declaration cannot be enough: SC
description: Appearing for social activist Akash Goel, advocate Mukta Gupta told a bench of CJI Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi that the directorate of census operations, which has commenced preparatory work for Census 2027, has not disclosed “any predetermined criteria or standardised methodology” for recording caste identity of people belonging to SC, ST and OBC categories during census.

title: 5-tier training model for Census house-listing
Trump administration sued over pause on immigrant visa processing
description: The lawsuit filed in federal court in ​Manhattan asked a judge to issue a court order blocking the policy, which took effect on January 21

title: Growth remains priority, looking  at more PSU divestment: FM Sitharaman
Parents to be blamed for allowing minors to drink & drive: SC
description: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said that there cannot be punishment before trial and directed release of the accused who already spent 18 months in jail. They were allegedly involved in tampering of evidence by swapping blood samples of their kids with their own. Father of the main accused, who is a minor and was allegedly driving the case, is still in jail.

title: ‘Arrogant, liar’: Mamata slams CEC after meet, asks why Bengal targeted
Rottweiler attack leaves Bengaluru woman with over 80 stitches
description: Days that once revolved around work, cuddles and caring for her breastfeeding child are now spent in a hospital bed, recovering from a brutal dog attack that has left her with more than 80 stitches across her face, throat and head — and scars that go far beyond the physical. Early on Jan 26, Shalini had stepped out for morning walk near home in HSR Layout’s Teachers’ Colony.

title: Wangchuk tried to create Nepal and Bangladesh-like unrest: Govt tells SC
description: Appearing before a bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and P B Varale, solicitor general Tushar Mehta said the activist was appealing to Gen Z to come out on the street against govt to create a problem in Ladakh which is very sensitive as it shares borders with countries that are not very friendly. Responding to Wangchuk’s submission that he was holding a peaceful protest against govt on the line of Gandhian principles, the SG said, “Gandhi was just a facade to hide his real intention of instigating violence.”

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX acquires xAI
description: A merger would represent one of the most high-profit corporate pairings in ​Silicon Valley, blending a space-and-defence contractor ⁠with a rapidly evolving AI developer whose costs are dominated by chips, data ​centres and energy

title: SC notice to govt as church body challenges anti-conversion laws
description: One of the laws challenged by the association is the nearly 60-year-old Orissa Freedom of Religion Act, 1967. Madhya Pradesh had enacted Chhattisgarh Dharma Swatantrya Adhiniyam in 1968 to prevent large-scale conversion of tribals. SC had upheld the constitutional validity of the Orissa and MP laws in 1977 in Rev Stanislaus vs State of MP case and said while the right to propagate religion is a fundamental right, it does not include right to convert.

title: Manipur set for govt, BJP MLAs to elect leader; Biren to be replaced
description: Official sources said BJP MLAs are in the national capital and will be electing a new leader, who will be sworn in as the new chief minister. The party has not officially declared a date for the legislative party meeting and named its general secretary Tarun Chugh as the central observer for the election of the new leader.

title: India, US have a deal, 50% tariffs cut to 18%
Trump says U.S. lawmakers are close to resolution on government funding
description: Mr. Trump ​told reporters ⁠that he had spoken with House ​Speaker Mike ⁠Johnson and Senate Majority Leader John Thune ‌and thought “they’re ‌pretty close to a ‍resolution”

title: Bengal SIR row: Didi storms out of meet with CEC, claims being ‘humiliated’
description: Talking to reporters later in front of Nirvachan Sadan — where a heavy police posse had gathered — she claimed to have warned the CEC that he will end up like Jagdeep Dhankhar, seen as a reference to the former VP’s sudden resignation last year. She was accompanied by party national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee, MP Kalyan Banerjee, and 12 members from what they claimed were “SIR-affected families” from Bengal.

title: 12-yr-old lured into trading Rs 85L jewellery for ‘unlimited momos’
description: According to a complaint filed by the boy’s father, a temple priest, the child had grown fond of momo sold at the roadside stall. The vendors allegedly began feeding him free of cost, winning trust bite by bite. Soon came bigger offers — food, small sums of money, loyalty. Then persuasion. Unaware of the stakes, the boy began removing jewellery from home and handing it over, police said.

title: Gen Naravane's memoir: Rules bar retired officers from publishing classified info
description: Senior military officials, particularly those dealing with classified information, are subject to regulations under the Official Secrets Act that restrict the publication of books or information even after retirement to prevent such classified material from becoming public. While a general one-year “cooling-off” period exists for taking up commercial or private employment, regulations for publishing secret content require prior govt clearance.

title: Rahul quotes from ex-Gen’s unpublished book on China row, gets Shah, Rajnath rap
description: Speaker Om Birla failed to defuse the situation even after he gave a ruling asking Gandhi not to refer to news articles or extracts from an unpublished book and speak only on what could be authenticated by placing it on record. The LoP maintained that he should be allowed to speak on the issue, saying excerpts of the unpublished book had been published in Caravan magazine and were authentic.

title: ‘No mechanical arrests over social media posts’: SC upholds HC order
description: The SC order may end the prevalent practice harassing people by filing mulitple cases against those whose social media post is critical of govt or party in power, and safeguards fundamental rights. The guidelines say the police must verify whether the complainant qualifies as the “person aggrieved” in terms of law before registering a case and conduct a preliminary probe before lodging an FIR.

title: Amid threats to ‘chicken’s neck’, India to take rail corridor underground
description: Ashwini Vaishnaw said the Budget contains a proposal to expand railway link between the region and the rest of the country to four tracks, fulfilling a long-felt need. Northeast Frontier Railway GM Chetan Shrivastava said the underground stretch would run from Tin Mile Haat to Rangapani stations within Bengal. During the 2017 Doklam stand-off, military planners had talked about the vulnerability of the Siliguri stretch of the corridor.

title: Will try to make Narela education hub a university township: CM
description: “Delhi’s students will benefit from it. We want to turn Narela into an education hub and will try to get it included in the initiative under which five university townships will be established near industry and logistics corridors,” said CM Rekha Gupta

title: Govt spent only 5% of funds for job, skilling schemes in FY 2026
description: Latest budget data released Sunday shows that govt spent nearly Rs 1,730 crore on the three components of the programme in FY26, out of a total of Rs 33,830 crore allocated in the 2024-25 budget. With the internship scheme having seen only two pilots, the Centre spent Rs 526 crore of Rs 10,800 crore allocated during FY26.

title: AI Boeing fuel switch cuts off again, this time at UK airport
description: The switch moved without the required lift action, suggesting the safeguard meant to prevent fuel supply cut off and inadvertent engine shutdown did not function as designed, sources said. The London incident challenges the controversial narrative that the Ahmedabad crash resulted from a deliberate pilot act, pointing instead to a possible and critical technical flaw in the aircraft’s fuel switch design.

title: ISRO tests thrust chamber for LOX-Methane Engine
description: The test was conducted at the Thrust Chamber Test facility at ISRO Propulsion Complex (IPRC), Mahendragiri on January 27, 2026

title: Cheer for exports: Textiles, carpets, leather set to gain after India-US deal
description: With the trade deal announced, Indian goods are suddenly looking more competitive. This means that a product will face 18% additional tariff over the MFN or product-specific rate. At 18%, the levy on Indian garments will be marginally lower than the 20% faced by those made in Bangladesh or Sri Lanka.

title: Markets recover more than half the post-Budget losses as Sensex gains 1.2%
Survey in and around Kolkata shows most students in 17-24 age group read books only occasionally
description: According to the survey, conducted by the Kolkata-based Sabar Institute and the Sarojini Naidu College for Women, 35% of students in the age group 17-24 years read only occasionally while 25% sat with a book daily

title: Modi knows how to earna name for himself: Vaiko
Trade deal done, says Trump; PM Modi thanks him for cutting tariff to 18%
description: While PM Narendra Modi, in a post on X, which followed US President Donald Trump’s announcement on Truth Social, said he had a wonderful conversation with “dear friend” Trump and thanked him on behalf of 1.4 billion people for the reduced tariff of 18% on Indian goods, he did not mention the trade deal at all in his post on X that followed Trump’s “wonderful” announcement.

title: Deepam row: Collector tenders unconditional apology to HC
‘Cong. leadership tells DMK its strength is being underestimated’
Trial commences in Coimbatore rape case, counsel for accused appointed
Rajasthan fully prepared to take advantage of budgetary incentives: CM
description: “The Union Budget will give new strength to all-round development of Rajasthan and support our resolve to achieve the development goals… It is a roadmap for a developed India,” Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma said

title: Rockets vs Pacers injury report: who’s playing, injured, records & stats
description: The Houston Rockets, despite key injuries to Durant, Adams, and VanVleet, are favored against the Indiana Pacers on February 2, 2026. Houston's core, led by Sengun and Thompson, will aim to exploit Indiana's defensive struggles and thin rotation. The Pacers will rely heavily on Siakam to keep pace in a game projected to be moderately high-scoring.

title: SAD claims Majithia a victim of political vendetta, after he gets bail in DA case
description: Senior SAD leaders Daljit Singh Cheema and Arshdeep Singh Kler alleged the State government had concocted a false disproportionate assets case against Mr. Majithia

title: Form 7 filings for deletion of names from electoral rolls spark outrage in Gujarat
description: Voters have claimed that their names, phone, and EPIC details were misused, and signatures forged to file false claims; Opposition parties blame the BJP, while the ruling party says SIR exercise is a transparent process and neither the party nor the government has any role in filing the applications

title: BJP names Tarun Chugh as observer for Legislature Party leader election in Manipur
description: MHA calls meeting with Kuki-Zo insurgent groups in indication that elected government could be restored in Manipur soon

title: Govt. orders schools to form fee regulation committees in 10 days
Parliament security breach case: police oppose bail to 3
Visible progress, invisible exclusion
description: India is perfecting a growth model designed to function with clinical efficiency, while quietly leaving its vast labour force behind

title: HPCL flags off SAKSHAM 2026 to promote fuel conservation
For Punjab, taking a leaf out of Haryana
description: The BJP is reaching out to SCs and OBCs, hoping to repeat its success in Haryana

title: India–US trade deal reaffirms what had started looking hazy: India’s role as US ally & China counter
Mamata’s Delhi visit a planned drama: Suvendu
India-US trade deal | How American and Indian leaders reacted: ‘Respect for PM Modi’
Two suspects detained in Samba; searches launched in Udhampur
description: On Jan 6, Punjab Police detained a minor in Pathankot on charges of spying and for allegedly sharing confidential information via social media to terror agencies, ISI, and Pakistan military officers. The detention prompted a statewide alert for similar espionage activities involving children. Under Operation Trashi-I, security forces have engaged in four encounters with terrorists in the past fortnight.

title: Wetlands as a national public good
description: There is a need to shift the focus from ‘projects’ to programmes and ‘beautification’ to ecological functionality, and ensure watershed-scale governance

title: ‘Appeasement politics’ of Congress will deny houses to Kannadigas: BJP
Remark on Prime Minister Narendra Modi plunges Karnataka Legislative Council into chaos
Why the timing is right for Arijit Singh to quit playback singing
description: The singer’s announcement at the peak of his career challenges Bollywood’s stereotypes and redefines what success in playback singing truly means.

title: Rajasthan SIR: Bulk Form 7 applications for voter name deletion surface in Barmer; BJP BLAs deny filing them
description: Hundreds of Form 7 applications seeking deletion of voter names surface mysteriously in Rajasthan’s Chohtan Assembly constituency; booth-level agents of the BJP in whose names the forms had been filed say they have not signed them

title: Man held for sexually assaulting 14-year-old daughter in central Delhi
Tamil Biennale will be held in January 2027, Stalin says at Global Tourism Summit
description: State govt. signs 127 MoUs worth ₹22,794 crore, which are likely to create 65,937 jobs. Tourism infrastructure such as theme parks and camping sites will be set up at 31 locations, says CM

title: I am not helpless, but sometimes truth becomes helpless before falsehood, says Karnataka Chief Minister
description: ‘I am the same Siddaramaiah, and I will continue to be the same Siddaramaiah in future also’

title: Upholstery unit gutted in fire in Kochi
Building permit ban near Pallikaranai marshland triggers protest
description: The CMDA circular halted all construction activity in the area pending the definition of a “zone of influence” by the Tamil Nadu Wetlands Authority

title: Stalin inaugurates eco park in SIPCOT Siruseri - Navalur lake
GCC to set up shelters for homeless persons recovering from illnesses
description: The civic body will identify land near hospitals to construct the shelters. It is also exploring the feasibility of establishing the facilities in buildings being constructed near tertiary care hospitals. Surveys to assess shelter gaps will begin soon, say officials

title: How seeing a parent’s overgiving behaviour, as Anusha Dandekar described, can cause lasting trauma: ‘You don’t know where you got it from until…’
A hat tip to Tamil Nadu’s industrial strength, reforms
description: The Economic Survey of India (2025-26) reinforces Tamil Nadu’s position as an investment-ready, industry-first State

title: Watch: After call with PM Modi, Trump announces trade deal with India, lowering of tariffs to 18%
description: In a post on social media, Trump described his phone conversation with Prime Minister Narendra Modi earlier in the day as an “honour,” calling the Indian leader “one of my greatest friends” and a “powerful and respected” figure.

title: T.N. gets more than ₹7,500 crore in the railway budget 2026-27
description: In a press note shared by the Southern Railway, total work costing ₹35,701 crore was under progress, comprising track construction, station redevelopment, and safety enhancements

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of ‘misleading’ the nation on 2017 Doklam issue
description: “Rahul Gandhi is not only wounding the dignity of Parliament through continuous false accusations and statements that spread confusion, but he is also hurting the morale of our valiant soldiers,” says BJP MP

title: Oral storytelling takes adults back in time
description: When we think of storytelling, it is mostly the children’s territory where storytellers perform stories with voice modulation and expression to hold their attention. What happened here was a reversal of that assumption, however

A cautious nudge: On the 16th Finance Commission’s recommendations
description: Only structural change can restore the balance in fiscal federalism

title: Over 7,000 property owners face auction for failing to clear long-pending tax dues amounting to ₹437 crore
Biju Radhakrishnan, three others booked in fresh cheating case
Police arrest 11 persons for autorickshaw racing
Uzbekistan's Abdusattorov wins Tata Steel Masters title, Gukesh best Indian at joint eighth
description: Gukesh drew with Vincent Keymer of Germany in the final round to end as the top performing Indian on 6.5 points. But, his fifty per cent score was below par and the Indian ace slipped below the 2750 rating mark

title: A full stop: On the top court, the right to menstrual health and hygiene
description: Making access to menstrual hygiene for girls a fundamental right is a big step

title: 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants deported and another 370 have been identified, says Karnataka Home Minister
description: Home Minister G. Parameshwara on Monday told the Legislative Assembly that 196 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants had been deported from Karnataka so far, while another 370 had been identified under the ongoing drive in this regard

title: Fifty years ago | Petroleum products from forest waste
KGMCTA defers boycott of OP services, academics for one week

title: Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
description: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.
